S31640-028:
BRONCHOSCOPY PROCEDURE NOTE – MECHANICAL DEBULKING

Patient: [REDACTED], 72-year-old male
MRN: [REDACTED]
Date: [REDACTED]
Facility: [REDACTED]
Attending: Dr. Leah Simmons

Indication:
Post-intubation tracheal stenosis with progressive dyspnea.

Procedure:
Flexible bronchoscopy with mechanical debulking of granulation tissue (CPT 31640).

Anesthesia / Sedation:
Moderate sedation with midazolam and fentanyl; topical lidocaine. ASA class III.

Findings:
Short circumferential granulation ring in distal trachea causing 60–70% narrowing.

Interventions:
Forceps debulking and snare resection used to mechanically excise granulation tissue. No balloon or ablation.

Hemostasis:
Minimal; controlled with cold saline.

EBL:
5 mL.

Complications:
None.

Disposition:
Discharged home after observation; follow-up bronchoscopy in 2–3 months.
